4 Ways to Make an Invisible File - wikiHow 
 Home Random Browse Articles Notifications Add to This Page Add Tip Add Photo Easy Ways to Help Approve Questions Review Tech Feedback Fix Spelling More Things to Try...   
 Log in / Sign up   
 Desktop Site   
 Talk How to Make an Invisible File   
 While there's no way to make a folder truly "invisible" to a determined user, you can hide your sensitive files and folders from regular computer searches by modifying a couple of system attributes (PC) or by using the "Terminal" app (Mac). After doing so, your new file will be invisible, both literally and to normal computer searches. 
 Steps Edit 
 Method One of Four: Hiding Your File (Windows) Edit 
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/a\/ac\/Make-an-Invisible-File-Step-1-Version-3.jpg\/v4-460px-Make-an-Invisible-File-Step-1-Version-3.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/a\/ac\/Make-an-Invisible-File-Step-1-Version-3.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 1 
 Right-click your desktop.  You'll need to create a regular file here first.
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/1\/1b\/Make-an-Invisible-File-Step-2-Version-3.jpg\/v4-460px-Make-an-Invisible-File-Step-2-Version-3.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/1\/1b\/Make-an-Invisible-File-Step-2-Version-3.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 2 
 Hover over "New". 
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/2\/21\/Make-an-Invisible-File-Step-3-Version-3.jpg\/v4-460px-Make-an-Invisible-File-Step-3-Version-3.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/2\/21\/Make-an-Invisible-File-Step-3-Version-3.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 3 
 Click a file type.  "Folder" or "Text Document" are quick and simple choices.
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/5\/50\/Make-an-Invisible-File-Step-4-Version-3.jpg\/v4-460px-Make-an-Invisible-File-Step-4-Version-3.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/5\/50\/Make-an-Invisible-File-Step-4-Version-3.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 4 
 Type in a name for your folder. 
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/6\/6c\/Make-an-Invisible-File-Step-5-Version-3.jpg\/v4-460px-Make-an-Invisible-File-Step-5-Version-3.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/6\/6c\/Make-an-Invisible-File-Step-5-Version-3.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 5 
 Hit  ↵  Enter . 
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/2\/28\/Make-an-Invisible-File-Step-6-Version-3.jpg\/v4-460px-Make-an-Invisible-File-Step-6-Version-3.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/2\/28\/Make-an-Invisible-File-Step-6-Version-3.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 6 
 Right-click your file. 
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/6\/60\/Make-an-Invisible-File-Step-7-Version-2.jpg\/v4-460px-Make-an-Invisible-File-Step-7-Version-2.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/6\/60\/Make-an-Invisible-File-Step-7-Version-2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 7 
 Click  Properties . 
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/e\/ec\/Make-an-Invisible-File-Step-8.jpg\/v4-460px-Make-an-Invisible-File-Step-8.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/e\/ec\/Make-an-Invisible-File-Step-8.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 8 
 Check the "Hidden" box. 
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/7\/76\/Make-an-Invisible-File-Step-9.jpg\/v4-460px-Make-an-Invisible-File-Step-9.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/7\/76\/Make-an-Invisible-File-Step-9.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 9 
 Click  OK .  Your file is now hidden, meaning it won't show up in search queries or your File Explorer app; however, if you create a regular folder in the same directory with the same name, it will rename itself to be "Filename (2)", which betrays the fact that you have a hidden folder in that directory.
 Your file is also literally invisible unless your computer is currently displaying hidden files and folders. 
 Advertisement 
 Method Two of Four: Finding Your File (Windows) Edit 
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/7\/71\/Make-an-Invisible-File-Step-10.jpg\/v4-460px-Make-an-Invisible-File-Step-10.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/7\/71\/Make-an-Invisible-File-Step-10.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 1 
 Type "hidden files" into the Start search bar. 
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/e\/ea\/Make-an-Invisible-File-Step-11.jpg\/v4-460px-Make-an-Invisible-File-Step-11.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/e\/ea\/Make-an-Invisible-File-Step-11.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 2 
 Click "Show hidden files and folders".  This should be the first item in the search list.
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/9\/98\/Make-an-Invisible-File-Step-12.jpg\/v4-460px-Make-an-Invisible-File-Step-12.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/9\/98\/Make-an-Invisible-File-Step-12.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 3 
 Double-click "Hidden files and folders".  If this option already shows two sub-options indented below it, skip this step.
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/1\/12\/Make-an-Invisible-File-Step-13.jpg\/v4-460px-Make-an-Invisible-File-Step-13.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/1\/12\/Make-an-Invisible-File-Step-13.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 4 
 Click "Show hidden files, folders, and drives". 
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/c\/cb\/Make-an-Invisible-File-Step-14.jpg\/v4-460px-Make-an-Invisible-File-Step-14.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/c\/cb\/Make-an-Invisible-File-Step-14.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 5 
 Click  OK . 
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/0\/0a\/Make-an-Invisible-File-Step-15.jpg\/v4-460px-Make-an-Invisible-File-Step-15.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/0\/0a\/Make-an-Invisible-File-Step-15.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 6 
 Close the "Hidden files" menu. 
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/f\/fa\/Make-an-Invisible-File-Step-16.jpg\/v4-460px-Make-an-Invisible-File-Step-16.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/f\/fa\/Make-an-Invisible-File-Step-16.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 7 
 Return to your desktop.  You should now see your previously-hidden file! It will appear transparent to indicate its "hidden" attribute.
 To hide your files again, return to the "Hidden files and folders" menu and click "Don't show hidden files, folders, or drives". 
 Advertisement 
 Method Three of Four: Hiding Your File (Mac) Edit 
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/2\/20\/Make-an-Invisible-File-Step-17.jpg\/v4-460px-Make-an-Invisible-File-Step-17.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/2\/20\/Make-an-Invisible-File-Step-17.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 1 
 Two-finger click your desktop.  You'll need to use the "Terminal" app to hide your folder.
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/2\/23\/Make-an-Invisible-File-Step-18.jpg\/v4-460px-Make-an-Invisible-File-Step-18.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/2\/23\/Make-an-Invisible-File-Step-18.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 2 
 Click  New Folder . 
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/1\/17\/Make-an-Invisible-File-Step-19.jpg\/v4-460px-Make-an-Invisible-File-Step-19.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/1\/17\/Make-an-Invisible-File-Step-19.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 3 
 Type in a name for your folder. 
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/0\/03\/Make-an-Invisible-File-Step-20.jpg\/v4-460px-Make-an-Invisible-File-Step-20.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/0\/03\/Make-an-Invisible-File-Step-20.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 4 
 Tap  ⏎  Return . 
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/7\/70\/Make-an-Invisible-File-Step-21.jpg\/v4-460px-Make-an-Invisible-File-Step-21.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/7\/70\/Make-an-Invisible-File-Step-21.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 5 
 Click the magnifying glass icon.  This is in the top right corner of your screen.
 You can also hold  ⌘  Command  and tap  Spacebar . 
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/d\/de\/Make-an-Invisible-File-Step-22.jpg\/v4-460px-Make-an-Invisible-File-Step-22.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/d\/de\/Make-an-Invisible-File-Step-22.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 6 
 Type in "Terminal". 
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/7\/73\/Make-an-Invisible-File-Step-23.jpg\/v4-460px-Make-an-Invisible-File-Step-23.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/7\/73\/Make-an-Invisible-File-Step-23.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 7 
 Tap  ⏎  Return . 
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/4\/4c\/Make-an-Invisible-File-Step-24.jpg\/v4-460px-Make-an-Invisible-File-Step-24.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/4\/4c\/Make-an-Invisible-File-Step-24.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 8 
 Type  chflags hidden . 
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/2\/2b\/Make-an-Invisible-File-Step-25.jpg\/v4-460px-Make-an-Invisible-File-Step-25.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/2\/2b\/Make-an-Invisible-File-Step-25.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 9 
 Drag your folder into Terminal. 
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/b\/bf\/Make-an-Invisible-File-Step-26.jpg\/v4-460px-Make-an-Invisible-File-Step-26.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/b\/bf\/Make-an-Invisible-File-Step-26.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 10 
 Tap  ↵  Enter .  Your folder should now be hidden from view! [1] 
 Hidden folders on a Mac are invisible unless you type a specific command into Terminal. 
 Advertisement 
 Method Four of Four: Finding Your File (Mac) Edit 
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/e\/e1\/Make-an-Invisible-File-Step-27.jpg\/v4-460px-Make-an-Invisible-File-Step-27.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/e\/e1\/Make-an-Invisible-File-Step-27.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 1 
 Click  Go .  This is in your screen's top right corner tool bar.
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/e\/e1\/Make-an-Invisible-File-Step-28.jpg\/v4-460px-Make-an-Invisible-File-Step-28.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/e\/e1\/Make-an-Invisible-File-Step-28.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 2 
 Click  Go to Folder . 
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/4\/41\/Make-an-Invisible-File-Step-29.jpg\/v4-460px-Make-an-Invisible-File-Step-29.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/4\/41\/Make-an-Invisible-File-Step-29.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 3 
 Type in  ~/Desktop/(FolderName) . 
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/8\/88\/Make-an-Invisible-File-Step-30.jpg\/v4-460px-Make-an-Invisible-File-Step-30.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/8\/88\/Make-an-Invisible-File-Step-30.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 4 
 Click  Go .  You should now be viewing your folder's contents!
 Any files you place in your folder will also be hidden. 
 Advertisement 
 Community Q&A 
 Search 
 Add New Question 
 How do I make the file visible again? 
								Answered by  
								wikiHow Contributor							 
 Go to Properties>Customize and click "Change Icon." 
 Thanks! 
 1 
 3 
 How can I see a created hidden folder? 
								Answered by  
								wikiHow Contributor							 
 Move your cursor over the place where you have created the folder. Or, better yet, press Ctrl+A. The "invisible" file will get selected as well. 
 Thanks! 
 0

 Tips Edit 
 You can also hide existing files and folders on both Mac and PC platforms. 
 0 
 Helpful? 
   0 
 You won't be able to find an invisible file in regular searches. 
 0 
 Helpful? 
   0 
 You can hide a folder in pretty much any directory on a computer--for example, your Documents file; you aren't bound to the desktop. 
 0

 Warnings Edit 
 A savvy user will know how to uncover hidden files.
